private_information: I can manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels (A, E, I, O, U).
I can only manipulate blocks that are at the top of a stack.
I can move one block at a time and place it either on the table or on top of another block.
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate to transform the initial stacks into the target stacked configuration where A is on top of B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I can manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants (all letters here except A, E, I).
I can only manipulate blocks that are at the top of a stack.
I can move one block at a time and place it either on the table or on top of another block.
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate to transform the initial stacks into the target stacked configuration where A is on top of B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' reports and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownward planner that encodes the multi-agent block rearrangement task and preserves agent-specific action ownership.

public_information: There are 11 uniquely labeled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K.
Only the top block of any stack is manipulable by an agent at any time.
Agents can move exactly one top block at a time and either place it on the table or on top of another block.
One agent may only move vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I); the other agent may only move consonant-labeled blocks (B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K).
Initial configuration: C is on the table, J is on the table, F is on the table.
A is on top of C.
K is on top of A.
E is on top of J.
B is on top of E.
D is on top of F.
H is on top of B.
G is on top of H.
I is on top of D.
Goal configuration: A on top of B, B on top of C, C on top of D, D on top of E, E on top of F, F on top of G, G on top of H, H on top of I, I on top of J, J on top of K, and K on the table.
All blocks must be in that final linear stack configuration with K on the table.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent that can handle vowel-labeled blocks. Provide an analysis of the environment focusing on the vowel blocks you can move, the constraints that affect you, and a concise list of feasible local moves or subgoals you can perform given only your private information and the public information. Do not emit PDDL. Provide explicit mentions of which top blocks you can currently manipulate and any assumptions you require to proceed.
report.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have access to the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} Your objective is: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Provide a concise, stepwise report describing: the vowel blocks you can act on initially, limitations you face, local move recommendations or subgoals you can perform without assuming access to consonant moves, and any information you need from the other agent to proceed.

report.system_prompt: You are an agent that can handle consonant-labeled blocks. Provide an analysis of the environment focusing on the consonant blocks you can move, the constraints that affect you, and a concise list of feasible local moves or subgoals you can perform given only your private information and the public information. Do not emit PDDL. Provide explicit mentions of which top blocks you can currently manipulate and any assumptions you require to proceed.
report.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have access to the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} Your objective is: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Provide a concise, stepwise report describing: the consonant blocks you can act on initially, limitations you face, local move recommendations or subgoals you can perform without assuming access to vowel moves, and any information you need from the other agent to proceed.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating the agents' reports and producing a complete PDDL domain and problem pair suitable for the FastDownward planner. Keep agent-specific actions distinct by prefixing action names with the agent identifier (for example, vowel_move and consonant_move). Ensure the domain encodes blocks, the table, predicates for on, clear, ontable, and agent ownership constraints. The problem must encode the given initial configuration and the target configuration. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target FastDownward: include appropriate :requirements and ensure typing and predicates are compatible with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the following inputs to produce a PDDL domain and problem that solve: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Here is the vowel agent report: {vowel_report} Here is the consonant agent report: {consonant_report} Keep actions belonging to different agents distinct and preserve the constraint that vowel actions only move vowel blocks and consonant actions only move consonant blocks. Encode initial state from the public information and encode the goal stack. Think step by step and produce a final domain and problem suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
